meanings.definition: The state or quality of being infrequent.
meanings.sent1: The infrequencies of his visits made it hard to predict when he would show up.
meanings.sent2: The infrequencies of rainfall in the desert led to a scarcity of water.
meanings.sent3: The infrequencies of the bus schedule caused many commuters to be late.
meanings.sent4: The infrequencies of her heartbeat worried the doctors.
meanings.sent5: The infrequencies of shooting stars made the night sky even more magical.

meanings.definition: The occurrence of something at irregular or uncommon intervals.
meanings.sent1: The infrequencies of power outages in the city surprised the residents.
meanings.sent2: The infrequencies of earthquakes in this region are a cause for concern.
meanings.sent3: The infrequencies of his jokes made them even funnier when he told them.
meanings.sent4: The infrequencies of her laughter brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The infrequencies of snow in this area make each winter special.
